Name: St. Vitus Cathedral
Description: Gothic cathedral in Prague Castle where Dr. Gessner floats above in prologue

Name: Prague Castle
Description: Largest ancient castle complex; contains Vladislav Hall where Katherine Solomon lectures

Name: Vladislav Hall
Description: Renaissance hall in Prague Castle used for indoor jousting; Katherine's lecture venue

Name: Wallenstein Palace
Description: Palace with symmetrical gardens; Dr. Gessner drifts over these gardens in prologue

Name: Four Seasons Hotel Prague
Description: Hotel where Robert Langdon stays in Royal Suite; upgraded by manager

Name: Strahov Swimming Center
Description: Sports complex where Langdon swims laps each morning; 3km jog from Four Seasons

Name: Vltava River (Central Prague)
Description: River snaking through Prague; visible from Castle Hill

Name: Charles University (Historical)
Description: Europe's oldest university (1348); organizes lecture series with Katherine Solomon

Name: Castle Hill (Hradčany)
Description: Historic district containing Prague Castle; slope descends to Old Town

Name: City of a Hundred Spires
Description: Nickname for Prague; Langdon's morning view

Name: Old Town (Staré Město)
Description: Historic center below Castle Hill; where Four Seasons Hotel is located
